refnamediv.refpurpose: Using Restrictions for Java hosted types.

refsect1.title: Overview
refsect1.para: The following tutorial demonstrates how Virtuoso can Restrict Java hosted types.

refsect1.title: Prerequisites
refsect1.para: The following prerequisites ensure the usability of these tutorial demos on any platform with a Java Runtime environment:

itemizedlist.listitem: Java SDK (if you seek to write your own Objects for integration with Virtuoso)
Virtuoso Universal Server with Java Runtime Hosting

refsect1.title: Tutorial Example
refsect1.para: Please follow the steps below to maximize the value of this tutorial:

orderedlist.listitem: Click on the "Set Initial State" link which registers the Java classes used in this demo with Virtuoso. Click on the "ho_s_13.sql" link to see the code behind this step
Click on the "Run" links to actually experience the demo

"ho_s_13.sql" performs the following steps
Registers the "Restricted" and "Unrestricted" Classes with Virtuoso as UDTs. Click on the "Restricted.java" and "Unrestricted.java" links to see the JAVA source code The Restricted types can't write to FS, can't read System envariment. For full list from restrictions, please see documentation.
